Description: Galvanizing of tubular components was being undertaken. Components upon a lifting attachment were immersed in molten zinc and then removed from the galvanizing kettle (containing molten zinc at 450c). A tubular item had end pieces attached, creating a cylinder should have had holes to allow the escape of expanding air during the immersion in the molten zinc. the holes were either not there or were blocked, causing the air to expand, and once the component was clear of the surface of the molten zinc bath, it exploded, fatally striking an operator."
Offence Date: This case did result from the investigation of a fatality
